title: constructed geometric face on Ken Garland's Illustrated Graphics Glossary cover
content:
Hi. Can anyone name the headline font used on the cover of Ken Garland’s, Illustrated Graphics Glossary (circa 1980)?

Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [IGG.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/typophile.com/files/IGG.jpg) | 46.93 KB |

 [‹ (x) Observations by Richard Avedon book cover - (similar to) H&FJ Didot {Patricia, Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/typophile.com/node/39021 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) In Celebration of Dads and Fatherhood script - Adine Kirnberg Script (Romana Script) {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/typophile.com/node/39003 "Go to next forum topic")
author: stuprice4

comments.content: Man, this reminds me of the 60’s, dude (lol). I’m thinking fonts like [Jampact NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jampact-nf/) and [Glyphic Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/glyphic-neue/).

Also similar: [Squeeze](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114045751/http:/www.typophile.com/bigsqueeze) by Chris Lozos. I don’t know if or when it will be released (or if it already has).

- Lex
